result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R. Schrock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Granted release privileges under 303.08(1). 
Execution of the sentence is stayed for not more than 60 days or until a date set by the Waupaca County Huber Law Officer, which ever date occurs first.  The defendant shall report to the Waupaca County Jail on the sentencing date to confirm a reporting date with the Waupaca County Huber Law Officer. 
Defendant entitled to earn good time per 973.09(1)(d) as calculated per 302.43.
Consecutive to: to 15CT77.

Elements

Defendant Michael R. Schrock in court with attorney Troy L. Nielsen. 
Brenda S Freeman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights, and enters guilty plea to Count 1. 
Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1. 
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read in. 
Court orders defendant to 30 days jail, to begin within 60 days, with Huber privileges and good time, consecutive to 15CT77. 
Defendant given 1 day credit. 
Defendant to pay costs. 
Defendant provided with notice of appeal rights.
